intro: Cyclandra papuana, commonly known as the Papuan cyclandra, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands, particularly Papua New Guinea. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and large, palmately lobed leaves. It produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Cyclandra papuana is often found in coastal and lowland areas, thriving in humid tropical climates.
